intro: Coluteastrum excisum, commonly known as the excised colutea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many plants with nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features small, pea-like flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces slender, pod-like fruits. Coluteastrum excisum is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
